CatDescriptText: Rev. James Anderson, Canonsburg and Mr. William Mosley, enamel plant employee, Canonsburg, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, May 26, 1962, pg. 8 with question: "Should better medical care be provided for the aged through Social Security?" Rev. James Anderson's answer reads: "I believe there should be because the older persons will have better security, there are a lot of elderly persons worrying about how they will be taken care of medically.  In a way, this is more important than life insurance."  Mr. William Mosley's answer reads: "I think so because for one thing, the older persons don't have any other way to secure medical care- it's the only thing they can depend on."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Rev. James Anderson wearing fedora, eyeglasses, and patterned necktie, standing on street with buildings; Portrait of William Mosley wearing plaid cap and moustache, standing on street with building in background marked "Luggage"
